description:
Works great, nice app for learning. 

Please support native window decoration! It's hard to see the borders without shadows. 
(I noticed that only on the flatpak package I encounter this issue)
summary: You should study and not read this

description: Work beautifully! It's my favorite app to train my memory.

I've been using Anki for years both on mobile and desktop to study for exams. The ability to add pictures and maths equations are a big help. 

There's been some recent issues with the Fedora and Ubuntu packages but it works fine on Debian and Solus. The flatpack has worked on all the systems/distribution that I've used.
summary: Flatpak works but certain distro packages don't work

description: Love this app. Works in a flatpak on Fedora system, and syncs with my Android phone app. Great job at making a super useful tool.
This thing is the god of flashcard apps.
The latest Flatpak is riled with bugs
Can't type 汉字 in any text field, because it doesn't support ibus input. However, I now just import from csv files. After that hurdle, everything works well.

I use this for improving my vocabulary. I love Anki's spaced repetition, which ensures that I don't have too much to study on any given day, yet whatever words I study are of greater impact.

I can sync this app with my phone, and everything just works with very little effort. The UI is not pretty, but everything works just fine. It has way more features than I can ever imagine myself using.
Really good app. Works well and has a ton of add-ons and huge community.
summary: Great app and well thought out

description: When the Anki icon is clicked, it appears briefly on the task bar and then disappears without an error message.

The only downside to the flatpak for me was not being able to easily use the TeX extension I though I needed. However, I actually really didn't need it, and just rendered the images outside of anki and then imported them as image files into anki. 

Anki has enabled me to improve my academics more than I thought was possible. Very good, give it time and be determined to learn how to use it and you will see improvement.
summary: Brilliant app, flatpak works great for me

description: This app does exactly what its intended to do and thus far I have not encountered any major issues.

Don't use the included .deb version, as other commenters have mentioned, it is out of date and doesn't work properly.

Anki really is the standard for flashcards, and you can download shared decks. I'm busy using it to reinforce my basic German.

The actual application is really good to use, connect it to AnkiWeb to sync and use it on your phone as well.
summary: Works fine if you use the Flatpak version from Flathub

description:
Anki is the best flashcard program there is. I don't experience any serious problems with it - I'm syncing with anki-droid, downloading shared decks, and installing plugins and it works.

The only issue is the state of the wayland support - there are no window decorations, but I don't think we should blame devs for this.

I installed Anki from flatpak on Debian 12 and it's been wworking perfectly for weeks now.
The software looks clean and is easy to use.
Whatever I do, no matter the deck, I cannot type the answare...
summary: The app does not let me write the answares

description:
this seems like a semi reocurring issue, this one specifically:
https://github.com/ankitects/anki/issues/1767

Otherwise excellent program, the methodology works, although i didn't want to believe it myself, and at times it feels I'm just learning disjointed words and concepts. I'm already three weeks in on my selected language, and can understand (like truly understand) about 1 in 100 sentences in my chosen language plus bits and pieces from the others.
I've been using this application for years, and it has helped me plenty of times with remembering things. I have no current issues on the flathub version
The first shown review, the guy says it doesnt work; he's just dumb and doesnt know how Linux even works, It works perfectly, it it doesnt run in wayland, just change to X11.
summary: It works perfectly (I'm using X11 with Nvidia Dvrs)

description: In wayland might not be perfect but in X11 it works 99%

A very useful app, but sorry to say, the Interface and navigation is a complete mess. The app is great once you figure out how to get to the things you're looking for, like customizing the fields, importing a deck into a specific deck, but the process to get there is very tiresome and cumbersome. UI/UX is not the apps strong points.

Will it ever look like as pretty as GNOME or Electron or Material with You or Fluent UI? No.
Will it support stable sync, performance, battery life, not eating 1G+ memory for a flashcard app, and fundamentally provides extensions and active maintainence? Yes.
As a flashcard app, you can:
export, import, sync, tweak algorithm, and do everything without killing performance or battery.
As a flatpak app, gets everything working under wayland!
Unverzichtbar um Sprachen oder ehrlich gesagt so ziemlich alles zu erlernen
Faulty locale keeps anki from starting. I managed to fix it by changing the locale system variables to "en_US.UTF-8". I assume non us user may only face this issue?
summary: locale settings keep anki from starting

description: Intuitiva a la par que eficiente.

excellent outils, complet, mais un peu difficile a prendre en main.

Je l'utilise en créant des cartes perso, je n'utilise pas de deck préfabriqué, ça me permet de garder en mémoire tout les points d'une leçon, aussi pour les langues, je mets les mots dans la langue étrangère, et en sens inverse des phrases en français à traduire.
summary: excellent outils, complet, mais un peu difficile a prendre en main
